result.execSummary:
The defendant Ka-Torris L. Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ka-Torris L. Jackson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ka-Torris L. Jackson was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: ****Costs are to be collected from case 21CM1548 over the term of probation in 22CF23 and 22CF718.**** If unpaid finacial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, ext of probation.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, ext of probation.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
****Costs are to be collected from case 21CM1548 over the term of probation in 22CF23 and 22CF718.****

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ka-Torris L. Jackson

records.addlTxt:
09:40 AM  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. DE appears by video from KCDC with Atty Christopher Bub. HYRBID HEARING.   Clerk P. Scypta.  
MINUTES:   Matter is resolved. DE sworn and consents to Branch 5 acting on behalf of Branch 1 for the purposes of sentencing. DE enters plea of guilty to Ct1 - found guilty by the Court. Cts 2 and 3 dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations.  Defendant is sentenced to 3 months in the Kenosha County Jail w/ huber consecutive to 22CF718 - IMPOSED AND STAYED. Defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions.   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. Court costs ordered.  No restitution requested. Notice of Dispo sent to KCJ.  Appeal rights given.
6/7/22 hearing rescheduled by court due to ongoing jury trial to - 7/8 10am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Daniel S, Brandee W, Jose A, Kayla A, Walmart in Kenosha.

01:39 PM  
  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Bub.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Referred to Br 1 for FPT on 6/7/22 @ 1030am.  $1000  Cash bond continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry).    jk
DE in custody and appearing today at 1pm Intake.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Bub appears for DE.  No appearance by DE.   Clerk HMcBride.   Atty Bub reports DE may have transportation issues today.  Court notes that DE lives within walking distance.  Court issues a BW $1,000 CB and forfeits bond.
Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Bub.   Clerk HMcBride.  Matters resolved. PLEAS 4/29 1030am.  Bond continued.

Defendant, Ka-Torris L. Jackson, appeared with Attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
